entry.title: Better than Revivify
entry.summary: This blog post discusses my journey of revitalizing my long-neglected website, transitioning to using Hakyll. Including styling with Clay, implementing syntax highlighting with Pygments, using KaTeX for mathematical typesetting, and optimizing font usage.

entry.title: What’s in the Name?
entry.summary: This blog post explores different approaches to implementing a lambda calculus interpreter. It examines various representation methods, including first-order representations and higher-order abstract syntax (HOAS).

entry.title: Roly, Oly, …, Polyvariadic Boogaloo
entry.summary: In the blog post, I author revisits the topic of polyvariadic functions in Haskell, building on a previous attempt by introducing type families to create a more streamlined implementation.

entry.title: Roly, Oly, …, Polyvariadic
entry.summary: This blog post illustrates the concept of polyvariadic functions, using the example of a function that can sum an arbitrary number of integers or return another function.

entry.title: Flooding my ’base
entry.summary: I discuss populating a database with generated data, resulting in a simple solution that generates objects sequentially, following a topological sort to ensure dependency preservation.

entry.title: Cat… amarphisms
entry.summary: Briefly explore the concept of catamorphisms in functional programming, primarily focusing on their application to algebraic data types, such as binary trees.

entry.title: Shuffle-athon
entry.summary: Examine the problem of shuffling a one-dimensional array in a single pass, employing a linked list structure along with reservoir sampling for random selection.
